channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Latest Alzheimer's lab tests focus on memory loss, not brain plaques
item.description: New tests of blood and spinal fluid can identify people experiencing memory loss from Alzheimer's disease.

item.title: The U.S. already has tariffs on a few sectors. It hasn't gone that great
item.description: The U.S. has generally kept tariffs low, but a few domestic industries have long been protected by import taxes and other trade barriers. They offer c...

item.title: Today is Trump's 'Liberation Day.' What does that mean for tariffs?
item.description: President Trump has been promising new "reciprocal tariffs" to punish other countries for their tariffs and trade barriers. Markets are nervous that a...

item.title: It's been a wild rollout of Trump's tariffs. Here's how we got here
item.description: President Trump's tariff talk has been big â€” and also unpredictable. He's frequently made threats only to back off or shift deadlines. Here, a look at...

item.title: States say Trump's continued freeze on much-needed FEMA aid violates a judge's order
item.description: Twenty-two states say the Trump administration is illegally freezing money from the Federal Emergency Management Agency. The administration says the f...

item.title: "JFK" director: Reinvestigate assassination at "scene of the crime"
item.description: Oliver Stone's "JFK" was nominated for eight Oscars and grossed more than $200 million but was also dogged by questions about its historical accuracy.

item.title: 'I didn't feel able to come forward' - Chinese victims tell BBC about serial rapist
item.description: Police in London say PhD student Zhenhao Zou's "offending group is far greater" than they had realised.

item.title: Israel to expand military operation and seize 'large areas' of Gaza
item.description: Defence Minister Israel Katz said this would require a large-scale evacuation of Palestinians.

item.title: Myanmar quake: Imam's grief for 170 killed as they prayed in Sagaing
item.description: Scores of Muslims in the town died when their mosques collapsed during Friday prayers at the end of Ramadan.

item.title: I-Team: FBI warns property owners, realtors about "title pirates"
item.description: The FBI's Boston office is issuing a warning after a series of I-Team investigations into stolen land scams.

item.title: Top Gun and Batman actor Val Kilmer dies aged 65
item.description: He starred in some of the biggest movies of the 1980s and 90s, also including The Doors and Heat.

item.title: Trump to announce new tariffs amid fears of higher prices
item.description: President Trump is expected to announce the details of his reciprocal tariffs plan after 4 p.m. at the White House.

item.title: Massive swells smash windows at Sydney's Bondi Beach
item.description: A powerful king tide smashed glass, cracked footpaths and caused residents to evacuate as it battered Sydney's coast line.

item.title: 4/1: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: What to expect in Trump's "Liberation Day" tariff announcement; Reporter's Notebook: Shifting rationale for Trump's "Liberation Day"

item.title: Forecasters warn of deadly floods and strong tornadoes in parts of the Midwest and South
4/1: America Decides
item.description: Trump tariff fears mount; A discussion with the authors of "Fight: Inside The Wildest Battle For The White House"

item.title: Republicans win Florida special elections in Trump strongholds by narrower margins than in 2024
item.description: Republicans Jimmy Patronis and Randy Fine have won special elections in two Florida congressional districts.

item.title: Democratic-backed Wisconsin state schools chief Jill Underly wins reelection over GOP-backed rival
